sen.j: 享保大判（きょうほうおおばん）とは享保10年（1725年）6月に発行された大判である。
sen.e: Kyoho-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin released in June 1725.
Kyoho-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin released in June 1725.
Kyoho-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin released in July 1725.
sen.cmt: June →July（グレゴリオ歴に変更しました）

sen.j: 享保小判享保丁銀は正徳 (日本)4年（1714年）の吹替え（改鋳）により慶長小判慶長丁銀の品位に復帰したが、大判についても慶長大判と同等のものに復帰することとなった。
sen.e: As Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-Chogin came to have its content of gold equivalent to that of Keicho-Koban Keicho-Chogin due to the currency reform of 1714, the Oban did the same to Keicho-Oban.
sen.cmt: 丁銀の音訳にsilverを補足した。「品位の復帰」は分かりにくいので少し噛み砕いて訳してみました。
sen.e: As Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-Chogin came to have its content of gold equivalent to that of Keicho-Koban Keicho-Chogin due to the currency reform of 1714, the Oban did the same to Keicho-Oban.
As Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-Chogin came to have its content of gold equivalent to that of Keicho-Koban Keicho-Chogin due to the currency reform of 1714, the Oban did the same to Keicho-Oban.

sen.j: この大判は初めて公式に通用価値が設定され、享保小判、享保小判享保一分判に対し、七両二分と価格が公定された。
sen.e: It was the first Oban to have an official currency value, and both Kyoho-Koban and Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-ichi (one) bu ban were given an official price of seven-ryo two bu.
sen.cmt: 「一分」の訳に（one）を補足した。数字の訳は日本語の音を訳としていません。
sen.e: It was the first Oban to have an official currency value, and both Kyoho-Koban and Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-ichibu-ban were given an official price of seven-ryo two bu.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: It was the first Oban to have an official currency value, and both Kyoho-Koban and Kyoho-Koban Kyoho-ichibu-ban were given an official price of seven-ryo two bu.

sen.j: 元文元年（1736年）の元文の吹替え（改鋳）後は元文小判に対し十両の相場が一般化した。
sen.e: After the Gembun's currency reform of 1736, the market price of ten-ryo for Gembun-Koban was generally accepted.
After the Gembun's currency reform of 1736, the market price of ten-ryo for Gembun-Koban was widely accepted.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: After the Gembun's currency reform of 1736, the market price of ten-ryo for Gembun-Koban was widely accepted.

tit.cmt: 大文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 表面は「拾両後藤（花押）」と墨書され、後藤十二代寿乗、十三代延乗、十四代桂乗、十五代真乗、十六代方乗、十七代典乗の書があり、上下左右に丸枠桐紋極印がそれぞれ一箇所、計四箇所打たれ、形状はやや角ばった楕円形であるが慶長大判より撫肩となる。
sen.e: It had the letters "ju-ryo (ten-ryo) GOTO (written seal mark)" written with indian-ink by Jujo GOTO the twelfth, Enjo the thirteenth, Keijo the fourteenth, Shinjo the fifteenth, Hojo the sixteenth and Tenjo the seventeenth on its face, and it was an oval coin a little angular but more rounded than Keicho-Oban, with a hallmark of paulownia in a circle each on the upper, lower, left and right parts of it.

it was an oval coin with slightly angular edges, but which was more rounded than the Keicho-Oban, and bore the letters "ju-ryo GOTO" written on the face of the coin in ink by Jujo, who was the twelfth family head of the GOTO clan, then by Enjo the thirteenth family head, followed by Keijo the fourteenth family head, Shinjo the fifteenth family head, Hojo the sixteenth family head, and Tenjo the seventeenth family head, and bore the stamp of a paulownia in a circle on all four corners of the coin.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: it was an oval coin with slightly angular edges, but which was more rounded than the Keicho-Oban, and bore the letters "ju-ryo GOTO" written on the face of the coin in ink by Jujo, who was the twelfth family head of the GOTO clan, then by Enjo the thirteenth family head, followed by Keijo the fourteenth family head, Shinjo the fifteenth family head, Hojo the sixteenth family head, and Tenjo the seventeenth family head, and bore the stamp of a paulownia in a circle on all four corners of the coin.

sen.j: 流通期間が長いことから墨書きの書き改めも頻繁に行われたため、後藤家六代に亘る墨書が存在することになった。
sen.e: Since it had long been in circulation, the ink writings on the surface were frequently renewed, resulting in the ink-writings by six generations of the Goto clan.
Since it was in circulation for a long period, the ink writings on the surface had to be regularly renewed, resulting in the ink writings by six genererations of the Goto clan.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Since it was in circulation for a long period, the ink writings on the surface had to be regularly renewed, resulting in the ink writings by six genererations of the Goto clan.

sen.j: 享保大判の現存数は万延大判についで多いが、初期の十二代寿乗による墨書は大変稀少である。
sen.e: The number of Kyoho-Oban existing is large next after Manen-Oban, and the ink-writings by Jujo the twelfth in his early days are very rare.
There are many existing Kyoho-oban, surpassed only by the Manen-Oban, although Kyoho-Obans with ink writings by the twelfth clan head, Jujo, are rare.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: There are many existing Kyoho-oban, surpassed only by the Manen-Oban, although Kyoho-Obans with ink writings by the twelfth clan head, Jujo, are rare.

sen.j: 裏面中央に丸枠桐紋、亀甲桐紋、花押の極印、左下に「久・さ・竹」、「久・石・竹」、「久・坂・竹」、「久・宇・竹」、「久・七・竹」のいずれかの極印が打たれている。
sen.e: It had the engraved hallmarks of paulownia in a circle and a hexagon and written seal mark at the center on its back, and had either one of the following on its down left: "hisa, sa, take,""hisa, ishi, take,""hisa, saka, take,""hisa, u, take," or "hisa, seven, take."
sen.cmt: 「久・さ・竹」、「久・石・竹」、「久・坂・竹」、「久・宇・竹」、「久・七・竹」は音の訳のみとしました。
sen.e: It had the engraved seal of an encircled paulownia, a hexagon, and a written seal mark at the center of the back of the coin, and had either one of the following on on the bottom left: "hisa, sa, take,""hisa, ishi, take,""hisa, saka, take,""hisa, u, take," or "hisa, shichi, take."
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: It had the engraved seal of an encircled paulownia, a hexagon, and a written seal mark at the center of the back of the coin, and had either one of the following on on the bottom left: "hisa, sa, take,""hisa, ishi, take,""hisa, saka, take,""hisa, u, take," or "hisa, shichi, take."

sen.j: 鋳造枚数は8,515枚であるが、この内15枚は大判座において試し吹きのため鋳潰され、発行されたのは8,500枚である。
sen.e: Eight thousand five hundred and fifteen of the Oban were minted, and fifteen of those were crushed for the use of test minting at an organization Obanza; as a result, 8,500 coins were released.
Although eight thousand five hundred and fifteen of the Oban were minted, fifteen of them were crushed in minting tests by the Obanza, that the total coins released was 8,500.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Although eight thousand five hundred and fifteen of the Oban were minted, fifteen of them were crushed in minting tests by the Obanza, that the total coins released was 8,500.

sen.j: 享保大判は慶長大判の品位に復帰するものであったが、通用が停止されていた慶長大判が両替商に持ち込まれた際の扱いについて、享保11年（1726年）4月に大岡忠相は通用を認めず潰金扱いの裁定を下した。
sen.e: Kyoho-Oban was to have its content of gold equivalent to that of Keicho-Oban; however, when it comes to the money-exchanger's handling of Keicho-Oban that had been suspended in currency, Tadasuke OOKA turned down its currency and took a decision to melt into metal in April 1726.

Kyoho-Oban was supposed to have it's gold content equivalent to that of the Keicho-Oban, but due to the money-handler's dealing of the Keicho-Oban, which was no longer in circulation, Tadasuke OOKA did not approve it's circulation and made the decision to melt it on April 1726.
sen.cmt: 意味をよりわかりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Kyoho-Oban was supposed to have it's gold content equivalent to that of the Keicho-Oban, but due to the money-handler's dealing of the Keicho-Oban, which was no longer in circulation, Tadasuke OOKA did not approve it's circulation and made the decision to melt it on April 1726.

sen.j: この扱いは正徳の吹替えにより通用を再び認められた慶長小判とは異なるものであった。
sen.e: He handled this Keicho-Oban matter differently from Keicho-Koban, which had been granted its currency again due to Shotoku's currency reform.
He handled this Keicho-Oban matter differently from Keicho-Koban, which had been granted its currency again due to Shotoku's currency reform.
He handled this Keicho-Oban matter differently from Keicho-Koban, which had been granted its currency again due to Shotoku's currency reform.

sen.j: 享保大判の通用期間は享保10年（1725年）12月1日より、万延元年（1860年）4月10日までであった。
sen.e: The period of currency was from December 1, 1725 to April 10, 1860.
The period of currency was from December 1, 1725 to April 10, 1860.
The period of currency was from January 3, 1726 to May 30, 1860.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴では、西暦1726年1月3日から西暦1860年5月30日までなので変更しました。
